0.post_text: Dear Valued Customers, we are performing scheduled system maintenance and upgrading works on our McDelivery system from 0500 hours to 0600 hours on 5 October 2016. Therefore, we are unable to accept McDelivery orders through our website, mobile app and hotline during this period. You may wish to visit our 24 hrs restaurants during this time. Please accept our sincere apologies for the inconvenience and bear with us in the meantime.

comments.message:
A very good effort by McDonald's to please the vegetarians. Singapore does have a huge vegetarian population (Chinese, Indians, Ang-mohs and the ever rising migrant population. McDonald's does give all of the people in this segment a choice to eat out anytime(24 hours) & anywhere(with it's outlets spread all over Singapore). There's also a huge number of people converting to vegetarianism because of health issues.                    https://blogs.ntu.edu.sg/hp331-2014-23/?page_id=86
How to order a Vegetarian Burger at McDonald's  
1. Choose bun - The Sesame bun "may contain eggs". As per the ingredients list of McDonald's. So, you can request to order their regular bun (which is eggless)
The Patty - Is meat free and fried in oil in which meat is not fried. But it does contain onion and garlic.
(*Request McDonald's to drop onion and garlic from their patty so many more people with different religious beliefs can consume this burger)
Mayo - definitely contains eggs
(*So those who don't consume animal products must request to minus Mayo from their burger)
Mc Chicken sauce - This is one of the sauces used in the Veggie Burger crunch. If you check the ingredients list in the McDonald's website, it says egg, onion & garlic. It doesn't contain chicken. But McDonald's does need to clarify why the name is Mc Chicken then???
So, while placing an order, You need to request them to avoid the Mc Chicken sauce too....
There....you have a vegan burger....but those who avoid onion and garlic can't consume it still. 
McDonald's please look into this. It's not easy to have a vegetarian burger on your menu and having chicken sauce as one of the ingredients. 
Please think of the strict Buddhists, Jains, Staunch Hindus. Many of them refrain eating onion and garlic during many festivities. 
Thank you McDonald's for being the first chain with such reachability to think of the Vegetarians🙇
Hi McDonald's , can you introduce the veggie burger from India McDonald's ? Their burger is Jain food friendly and contains no onion and garlic. Thanks

This burger is no way stated as vegetarian people. This is Veggie Crunch, not Vegetarian Crunch.
Please read the post. Spices contains natural extracts of garlic and onion and sauce contains garlic.
please remove egg from your burger...some people are pure veg..not even egg they eat

Hi, this was the correspondence (as attached) that a friend of mine had with you which you have confirmed the information with regards to the ingredients. Would appreciate if you could clarify on the conflicting information above. This would definitely clear up any misinformation for vegetarian consumers. Thanks.
It's got egg so it does not make it vegetarian!

The ingredients on the box says it contains chicken sauce...
Veggie patties are cooked with the stove that the crew use to cook McChicken & McSpicy + McNuggets and Filet-O-Fish, therefore veggie burger basically & theoretically a non-vegetarian burger.

But nonetheless even if it's veggie patty, the oil they fried in it in turn become non-vegetarian as the oil previously could have used to fried chicken patty for mcspicy or fish burger.. so yea do take note
Seriously!Which part of it do people not understand?It is a veggie burger or meatless burger,not a vegetarian burger.Note the difference,duh.
Tried this Veggie Crunch Burger. Thumbs up McD! It is delicious ;)

The Veggie Crunch Burger contains allergens. Spices used contain natural extracts of garlic, onion and pepper. Ingredients in Veggie Crunch sauces include egg and garlic. Neither meat nor dairy is used in the burgers.

Hi. What is the point of providing mcdelivery services when every single time I tried to order, the restaurant is unable to deliver? This is not the first time or the second time it happens. Every single time I tried via the app, the hotline or the website, I get the "unable to deliver message" If a restaurant cant deliver, then what is the point of providing a delivery service? 

I am very very annoyed with this issue and nobody seem to be able to help but tell me, I'm really sorry we cant deliver? How is it possible that sometimes at even 4am in the morning, the restaurant is experiencing high call volumes and are unable to deliver?
Fraser Marsden Tyler FYI pal 😉

I think you dont need to have the app or better still just delete it alltogether as it has been happening very often than what not..if ur gonna provide wit delivery services is it too hard to regularly maintain the traffic flow of consumer using the app?its rather ridiculous to have to go and walk in as it defeats the purpose of having the "delivery services"very2 annoyed

comments.message: MacDonald's. What the hell is this? How am I supposed to enjoy the cheese with the Fillet burger?

Hi MCD, could you please give me a reasonable explanation what's happen to your food. I bought it from Bedok Reservoir Road's MCD today and this is what I got. Please make sure your food serving clean and fresh!

QW-27/09/2016-91

I would like to complain about the long delay which I've experienced on my delivery order tonight. I've placed my order with you around 8pm for an advance order to be sent to my residential address at 10.15pm. I waited until 10.40pm and my order was still not delivered. Then I called up the MacDonald hotline to enquire. The contact centre staff told me that the restaurant will get in touch with me shortly to update me on the status of my order. Another 15 mins went by and there was still no news. So I rang the hotline again to inform them that I would like to cancel my order and instead of showing me any empathy, the contact centre staff asked if I've made payment via credit card. If so, it takes up to 14 days for the refund. First, I did not cancel this order out of my own accord. The order was not fulfilled by MacDonald to me as a consumer and so, I sought to cancel. I do not see why I still have to wait for 14 days for my monies to be refunded to me. This is simply not the right way to do business, not at all. It is a service lapse on MacDonald's part and I presume I've the right to be compensated and proper service recovery to be carried out. FYI: I ended up with no dinner tonight after a late night at work. All thanks to you, MacDonalds.

Regards,
Charlene Chen

Improve your customer service. The staff at paya lebar square sucks big time. When i ask if they had bbq sauce, they said yes for my take away order but when i check it's not there. This happens countless times! Have more pride in your work

14.post_text: Dear Valued Customers, we are performing scheduled system maintenance and upgrading works on our McDelivery system from 0300 hours to 0500 hours on 13 Sep 2016. Therefore, we are unable to accept McDelivery orders through our website, mobile app and hotline during this period. You may wish to visit our 24hrs restaurants during this time. Please accept our sincere apologies for the inconvenience and bear with us in the meantime.

19.post_text: ONE FM 91.3 DJs Glenn Ong and FD can't agree on which is the best-tasting Signature Collection burger. So they're having a showdown between their favourite burgers right now at McDonald's Springleaf Tower. When the people have voted, one will walk away with bragging rights. And one will walk all the way to Gardens By the Bay to fulfill the forfeit! Who do you support? Give a shout-out to your preferred team in the comments.

comments.message:
I am here to make a complain regards your lack of service in sending me and my Wife the correct. You guys late for about 30 mins from 11pm I waited till your estimated of 1.15am, but your guys came at 1.40am, and there's more to come, you guys missed of delivering my 6pc nugget, classic cheese and a coke. And your hotline told me will contact store to call me, I called again after 20 mins but your another hotline also told me that... Your hotline named Kali said today morning there will be a manager to call us back but till now nothing have happen. So till now we do not have the correct food that we should have and I want a full refund which my Wife paid via Visa card. I will surely post it on the social media

Jeremy

Hi McD,
Good day to you. This is my third attempt at contact.
We really applaud your effort in bringing food to the people and it would definitely enlighten us if you could assist us in clearing up a few doubts. Is it a norm:
1.	for the delivery time to be 2 hours?
2.	for the delivery to be more than an hour later than the estimated time of arrival?
3.	to deliver liquid sundae? 
4.	to shortchange customers by delivering fewer items than we paid for?
5.	to INSIST that the number of items sent was correct?
6.	for customers to look at the list of items and then read out the list to the STORE MANAGER and then have the STORE MANAGER INSIST that there was no discrepancy when it was so apparent that there was a shortage of 2 McSpicy, 2 Milos and 1 Coke?
7.	to deliver fries as though they had gone through a marathon and soaked in its own perspiration?
8.	for the STORE MANAGER to shout at customers when we were all so patient trying to get what we paid for?

We do sincerely believe that the answers to the questions above is a NO. However, please feel free to correct us if our expectation of no to the questions above does not match with the McD reality. 
It was a perfectly fine-weathered evening gathering for a group of friends in which an advertising-worthy day as depicted by your TV commercials could have happened. It really could have been. Nonetheless, on that day of the incident, a report was made via your popular hotline. We were promised updates via email but as of now we have not received any updates. Thus to facilitate you in expediting and investigating, please refer to Order Number: SRA3-21/08/2016-158.
Moving forward, would you be so kind to advise if we should continue to anticipate updates or have your company forgotten about this? We will definitely be appreciative of your kind gesture to provide us with closure for the death of our advertising-worthy day.
